data.title: Great atmosphere, Standard Chinese Food.
data.text:
This is my restaurant of choice when it comes to Chinese food. It's just down the road from me, and the combination fried rice is delicious (and is enough for two, three people easily). They have a lot of "unique" dishes compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area. the Tien Tien Beef is particularly good, though they put a lot of veggies in it and not that much beef. Their Hot and Sour Soup is... interesting. It's not like a sweet/sour sauce that you'd expect, but almost like the sour from fermented veggies. It's very filling, though, so maybe only get that if you intend to share. All their soup is made to order (and serves two people), too, so it's nice and hot when you get it. 

My preferred entrees are, in order, the Seafood Sizzling Rice (a delicious medely of shrimp, scallops, and crab over "sizzling" rice, which seems to be just puffed rice), Sesame Chicken, and Tien Tien Beef. The Sesame Chicken is good, plump chunks of chicken, not little crumbs of crust with something like chicken skin in the middle. As I said before, the Tien Tien Beef is delicious, but a bit too much veg in it for my taste. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in Hoover looking for good Chinese.

data.title: The best Chinese in town!!!
data.text: Don't miss the Mandarin House - it's been in business over 25 years and is open on Christmas Day! Change your traditions and Have some Chinese food for Christmas!  You will not be disappointed here -HUGE portions, lunch prices, so many choices, and the best hot and sour soup ever. I personally love anything "spicy" here as well as sesame chicken. My hubby orders Shrimp and lobster sauce and Hunan beef for his faves. Definitely worth the drive!

data.title: Average
data.text: This is a good Chinese restaurant.  Many years ago, before the management/ownership changed, it was a great restaurant with many remarkable dishes.

data.title: Old stand by
data.text: My Dad and I have been eating lunch here for 35 years. Is it the best Chinese food?  No but it is good Chinese food. I have the almond chicken and consistently it is a solid effort. The soups are good and the egg rolls are not too greasy. Do not expect to wowed by the decor. It is an old established restaurant in a strip mall. Just know that you will be in and out within an hour and you will be full at a reasonable price.

data.title: Delicious! The best hot and sour soup!
data.text: My husband and I eat here very often.  They have the best hot and sour soup!  Their moo shu pork is super delish as well! They can cater and make your dish any way you want it. The owners are so very nice and treat us very special each time we visit.  They remember our order and give us the VIP treatment!  Their dishes are made fresh and it has a nice and pretty atmosphere.  It is sort of tucked away but if you are in the mood for Chinese food, please give this wonderful place a try!

data.title: Not a typical Chinese to go place
data.text: We've been dining here and taking out for a while now and while the front looks like a typical Chinese To Go place, it's quite nice inside. Located on a strip mall-esque place, the inside is heavily decorated with Oriental decors and trinkets with Chinese music silently playing in the background. The lighting is subdued even though it's really bright and sunny outside, making it ideal for couples to dine in. I'd probably avoid rush hour if you want peace and quiet. Speaking of rush hour, the seem to be short staffed so there'll be a bit of a wait during rush hour. The staff are nice and accommodating, especially the old lady at the counter who I'm guessing is the owner. The menu shares some dishes with your typical Chinese to go place, but there are some dishes that are unique to this place. The food is quite good and serving is plentiful, prices are just what you should expect, not too expensive, not too cheap. They even have an app where you can order online and just pick up.

data.title: Horrible
data.text: Have been going since the 80's. The roach doing the back stroke in the sweet sauce for the egg rolls did it in for me. Waiter just shrugged it off.

data.title: Horrible food
data.text: The food was horrible.  We got the Mongolian beef .  It was like eating beef jerky.  The sesame chicken was soaked in sauce and the cashew chicken had stale cashews.  Now I remember why I hadn't visited in several years

data.title: Best seafood hot sour soup
data.text: All I can say is the best Chinese food in town the people very friendly food are always fresh don't miss the hot sour soup

data.title: Pleasant experience
data.text: This is a great place to call in and pickup but also good for eating in as well.  The staff were all friendly and had my order hot and ready when I arrived.  The crab rangoons were some of the best I've ever had!  I also recommend the hot 'n sour soup and house lo Mein.

data.title: Best Chinese in Birmingham
data.text: This picture is not of this restaurant.....Family owned and if you are lucky the three precious little girls will make an appearance...Soup and egg rolls and drinks come to your table almost before your rump hits the chair....Tien Tien bee,is just spectacular,with crisp noodles not lettuce... Lots of food.unbelievable servings for lunch.....fabulous egg drop and won ton soup...

data.title: Hot Food.  Frequent Visitor.  Pleasant
data.text: I would say this is in my top 10 Birmingham Eateries, based on pleasant memories.  Comfort food for sure. Family managed. Great service. Ok food. Egg Rolls and soup are great.  Make a memory.

data.title: good chineese food
data.text: hot food ready to serve friendly people clean restaraunt the people that work there were clean and i loved it

data.title: Lot of Food for the Money
data.text: Like that you had lot of good food, but if I had known how much food I was getting. My family would have only order one  or two plate instead of 3. I wasted food and money.
